Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 10:22PM kiara wrote: I had my lumpectomy 5 years ago and I plan to imitate Nancy Regan who is almost 90 jajajjaja. I exercise every day 15 to 30 minutes, eat plenty of fruits and vegetables, never smoked, keep my alcohol to 3 or 4 glasses of red wine a month, do not drink water from plastic bottles, keep stress level low and love, love, love.  I also take plenty of vitamins, and love each day I wake up. Last, but not less important, have a great faith in the Lord. God bless you.
Posts.Title: Living 5+ years after stage IV lrixen lrixen

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 11:34PM kiara wrote: Linda, yes some of us experience fatigue and other do not. I had radiation for 6 weeks at 8:00 am and then I went to work, never missed a day, but I felt very tired some days.  No one knew of my bc at work so I could not complain, jajajja. Blessings
Posts.Title: Fatigue at the beginning of radiation? Linda37 Mary22
